title: TC001-User Login with Email
description: Verify successful user login using email and password with Supabase authentication.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to login page by clicking the 'Entrar' link.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click the 'Entrar' link to navigate to the login page.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/nav/div/div/div[2]/div/span/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Input valid email and password, then click the 'Entrar' button to attempt login.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input valid email into email field.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div/div/div[2]/div[2]/form/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('testuser@example.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input valid password into password field.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div/div/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('correct_password')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click the 'Entrar' button to submit login form.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div/div/div[2]/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Try to use the 'Login R치pido (Dev Only)' buttons to log in as a test user to verify successful login with Supabase authentication.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click the 'Admin' button under 'Login R치pido (Dev Only)' to log in instantly as a test user.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div/div/div[3]/div[2]/div/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click the 'Pular tutorial' button to skip the tutorial and complete the login verification.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click the 'Pular tutorial' button to skip the tutorial and finalize login.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[3]/div/div/div[3]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Welcome back! Here\'s an overview of your projects.').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Create Project').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Total Projects').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=4').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Active projects').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Active Renders').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=0').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=System Status').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Overall Health').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=healthy').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC008-Video Rendering Pipeline Success Flow
description: Verify starting a video rendering job queues the task correctly, provides real-time progress updates, and outputs video files in selected resolutions and codecs.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Click on the 'Render Dashboard' button to access the video rendering job interface.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click the 'Render Dashboard' button to go to the video rendering job interface
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div/div[2]/div[4]/div[2]/a/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click the 'Editor' quick login button to authenticate and access the dashboard.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click the 'Editor' quick login button to authenticate and access the dashboard
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div/div/div[3]/div[2]/div/button[2]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click 'Pular tutorial' to close the tutorial modal and access the dashboard interface.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Pular tutorial' to skip the tutorial and access the dashboard
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[3]/div/div/div[3]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click the 'Criar Primeiro V칤deo' link to start creating a new video rendering job with specific resolution and codec parameters.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click the 'Criar Primeiro V칤deo' link to start a new video rendering job
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div[2]/div/div/div/div[3]/div/div[2]/div/div/div/span/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click the 'Tentar Novamente' button to retry loading the editor canvas and attempt to access the video rendering job interface again.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click the 'Tentar Novamente' button to retry loading the editor canvas
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/button[2]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Video Rendering Completed Successfully').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test failed: The video rendering job did not queue correctly, real-time progress updates were not received, or the final rendered video outputs are not available as expected.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC009-Video Rendering Job Cancellation
description: Verify users can cancel an ongoing rendering job and the system stops processing accordingly.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Click on 'Render Dashboard' to access the rendering job interface.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Render Dashboard' button to go to the rendering job interface
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div/div[2]/div[4]/div[2]/a/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Perform quick login as test user by clicking 'Editor' button for quick login.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Editor' button for quick login as test user
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div/div/div[3]/div[2]/div/button[2]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click 'Pular tutorial' button to skip tutorial and access dashboard.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Pular tutorial' button to skip tutorial and proceed to dashboard
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[3]/div/div/div[3]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click on 'Create Project' button to start a new video rendering job.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Create Project' button to start a new video rendering job
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/div/div[2]/div[2]/div/div/div/div/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click 'Create Project' button to create the new video rendering project and start the rendering job.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Create Project' button to create the new video rendering project and start rendering job
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[4]/div[3]/button[2]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Rendering job completed successfully').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test failed: The rendering job cancellation did not complete as expected. The job should be cancelled and no partial outputs should remain, but the UI does not reflect the cancellation state.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())
